Module: CButton.hpp Description: CButton class for handling PtButton widgets

Member Function Documentation

CButton::STANDARD_CONSTRUCTORS ( CButton ) [pure virtual]
 

Creates a button at position x, y, containing certain text The constructor checks if the button is created as a child of a PtMenu widget. If this is the case, the horizontal alignment is automatically set to Pt_LEFT, because one usually doesn't want centered menu items

Reimplemented from CLabel.

int CButton::setArmColor ( PgColor_t armColor )
 

The background color used when the button is armed (pressed in).

int CButton::setArmData ( void * armData )
 

contains a pointer. If the label type (Pt_ARG_LABEL_TYPE) is Pt_Z_STRING, this resource points to a text string. If the label type is Pt_IMAGE, this resource points to a PhImage_t structure. For more information, see PtLabel. Set the flags member of the PhImage_t structure to: Ph_RELEASE_IMAGE | Ph_RELEASE_PALETTE | Ph_RELEASE_TRANSPARENCY_MASK | Ph_RELEASE_GHOST_BITMAP before providing the image to the widget. If you do this, the memory used for the image is released when the widget is unrealized or destroyed.

int CButton::setArmNoFill ( )
 

determines whether or not Pt_ARG_ARM_COLOR will be used
